entity1.name: architecture
entity1.description: The human-made surroundings that provide the setting for human activity, ranging from buildings to parks and other public spaces.;;;The art and science of designing and constructing buildings and other physical structures.;;;Areas designed for public use and access, such as parks, squares, or streets.;;;A structure designed to house governmental functions, often featuring grand columns and a domed roof.;;;Buildings designed to minimize energy consumption and environmental impact.;;;Areas that are accessible to the general public, such as parks, squares, and streets.;;;Structures that are constructed for various purposes, such as residential, commercial, or industrial use.;;;A designated area for public recreation, often featuring greenery and seating.;;;Areas that are open and accessible to all members of a community, such as parks, squares, and streets.
entity1.chunkid: The Influence of Architecture on Society11;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society4;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society20;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society10;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society21;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society7;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society25;;;The Influence of Architecture on Society24

entity2.name: society
entity2.description: A community or group of people regarded as a single entity, often sharing common interests or living in the same area.;;;A group of people living in the same area and having common interests.;;;A community or group of people regarded as forming a single entity, often sharing common interests, culture, or institutions.;;;A community or group of people regarded as forming a single entity, often sharing common interests or values.
